instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Blown <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR> looks burnt. Literally has a hole in it. Afraid to power up and cause damage, as I only have 1 good <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR> left.
Any hypothesis on what can cause this?
Also, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> has 0.7 OHM resistivity to ground. Is this normal? The fucked up donor board is measuring the same resistivity on that line.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Blown <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message: First you need to remove the short or <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR> will die again. Inject voltage and see what heats up.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Blown <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message: The customer only wanted to buy (they can replace it themselves) or replace <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR> because they spotted that it was fried and brought it to have only this fixed. I replaced and cautioned that the cause is not resolved and quoted them for a future "comprehensive repair" from which I will deduct my fee for this single replacement. If it comes back I'll update this thread.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Blown <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message:
Those are customers you DON'T need!
He will install a new <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR> and it will instantly fry again because of the short or he will just kill the board. Then he will be back to complain.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Blown <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message: duke and I are almost always on the same page with customer service :)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Blown <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message: Customer didn't come back yet. Can we mark it as "closed" for now and if needed will open a new case later on.
